title: Wipro's 2Q Net Profit Rose 35%, Beating Expectations
text:
By Saurabh Chaturvedi

Wipro Ltd. (507685.BY) reported a 35% increase in net profit for the fiscal second quarter, supported by stronger sales.

Net profit for the July-September period was 25.53 billion Indian rupees ($358.3 million), compared with INR18.89 billion a year earlier, the software and services company said Tuesday.

The result beat the INR22.91 billion net profit forecast by analysts polled by FactSet.

Revenue rose to INR151.26 billion in the quarter, Wipro said. It was expected to post revenue of INR149.01 billion, according to FactSet.

Providing IT services to industries such as banking, financial services and insurance is key to its overall sales.

For the quarter through December, Wipro said its expects revenue from IT services to be between $2.07 billion and $2.11 billion.

Write to Saurabh Chaturvedi at saurabh.chaturvedi@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 15, 2019 07:19 ET (11:19 GMT)
